content.text: A
kg
C
s
Which unit is not an SI base unit?
What is the best estimate of the number of atoms in a piece of metal of volume \(50 \text{cm}^3\)?
accurate and precise
accurate but not precise
not precise and not accurate
precise but not accurate
A copper pipe has a true diameter of \(42.03 \text{mm}\)
A builder measures the diameter of the pipe five times using digital calipers. The measurements are shown
What describes the builder's measurements?
5N
Two forces, each of 10 N, act at a point P, as shown. The angle between the directions of the forces is \(120^{\circ}\)
What is the magnitude of the resultant force?
They have the same average speed
They have the same average velocity
They have the same displacement
They travel the same distance
One object moves directly from P to R
R
Q
P
In a shorter time, a second object moves from P to Q to R
Which statement about the two objects is correct for the journey from P to R?
A ball is kicked so that it has an initial velocity of \(12 \text{m s}^{-1}\) at an angle of \(50^{\circ}\) to horizontal ground
Assume that air resistance is negligible
What is the maximum height above the ground that is reached by the ball?
0.750 m s⁻¹ B 3.00 m s⁻¹ C 7.36 m s⁻¹ D 29.4 m s⁻¹
A camera drone of mass \(1.20\mathrm{kg}\) hovers at a fixed point above the ground. The drone has four propellers
In a time of \(1.00 \mathrm{s}\), each propeller pushes a mass of \(0.400 \mathrm{kg}\) of air vertically downwards
Assume that the air above the propellers is stationary
What is the speed of the air leaving each propeller?
A box rests on the Earth, as shown
Newton's third law describes how forces of the same type act in pairs. One of the forces of a pair is the weight \(W\) of the box
Which arrow represents the other force of this pair?
A small ball is held at the surface of liquid oil in a container. The ball is released from rest and falls through the oil. The ball has velocity \(v\). A viscous (drag) force \(F\) acts on the ball
Which graph could show the variation with \(v\) of \(F?\)
5u
An object of mass \(m\), moving at speed \(u\) along a frictionless horizontal surface, collides head-on with a stationary object of mass \(4m\)
before the collision
After the collision, the object of mass \(m\) rebounds along its initial path with \(\frac{1}{4}\) of its kinetic energy before the collision
What is the speed of the object of mass \(4m\) after the collision?
1.3 N m
2.5 N m
2.7 N m
5.4 N m
The driver of a car applies two parallel forces to a steering wheel, as shown
Each force has a magnitude of \(15 \text{N}\) and acts in the direction shown. The steering wheel has a diameter of \(0.40 \text{m}\)
What is the torque exerted on the steering wheel?
using a longer rod and moving the pivot closer to the tank
using a longer rod and moving the pivot further away from the tank
using a shorter rod and moving the pivot closer to the tank
using a shorter rod and moving the pivot further away from the tank
A farmer is trying to lift the corner of a large water tank. She uses a metal rod as a lever
The vertical force from the farmer is constant and is always applied to the end of the rod
Which change **must** increase the upward force on the water tank?
\(P = T\cos \theta\) and \(W = T\sin \theta\)
\(W = P\tan \theta\) and \(W = T\cos \theta\)
The diagram shows a ball of weight \(W\) hanging in equilibrium from a string
The string is at an angle \(\theta\) to the vertical. The tension in the string is \(T\). The ball is held away from the wall by a horizontal force \(P\) from a metal rod
Which relationship between the magnitudes of \(T, P\) and \(W\) is correct?
force per unit area
force per unit volume
mass per unit area
mass per unit volume
Which expression for pressure is correct?

A ball has a mass of \(0.50\mathrm{kg}\) and a volume of \(1.3\times 10^{- 3}\mathrm{m}^3\) . The ball is floating in equilibrium on still water. The two forces that act on the ball are its weight and the upthrust due to the water
The density of the water is \(1.0 \times 10^{3} \text{kg} \text{m}^{- 3}\)
What is the percentage of the volume of the ball above the surface of the water?
2.6kJ
3.1kJ
3.4kJ
4.0kJ

A man sits on a buggy that is pulled along by a wire attached to a kite. The wire is at an angle of \(40^{\circ}\) to the horizontal and has a constant tension of \(200 \text{N}\). The man and buggy travel a distance of \(20 \text{m}\) along a straight horizontal path. The wire and the path of the buggy are in the same vertical plane
What is the work done by the tension force on the man and buggy?
The kinetic energy of the ball decreases as the gravitational potential energy decreases
The kinetic energy of the ball decreases as the gravitational potential energy increases
The kinetic energy of the ball increases as the gravitational potential energy decreases
The total energy of the ball increases
A ball is thrown vertically upwards from the surface of the Earth
Which statement describes the energy of the ball as it rises through the air?
A lamp is suspended in equilibrium from a fixed support by three long identical wires
The weight of the lamp causes each wire to have an extension of \(0.40 \text{cm}\). The height \(h\) of the lamp above the floor is measured
The middle wire suddenly breaks and the lamp falls a small distance as the extensions of the remaining two wires increase. The wires obey Hooke's law
When the lamp is in equilibrium, the height \(h\) of the lamp above the floor is measured again
What is the difference between the two values of \(h?\)
the area under the graph
the gradient of the graph
the reciprocal of the gradient of the graph
twice the area under the graph
The force–extension graph for a spring is shown
What represents the work done to extend the spring?
In an experiment, a student uses a microphone and a cathode-ray oscilloscope (CRO) to analyse a sound wave. The diagram shows the trace on the screen of the CRO
The student is expecting a sinusoidal waveform to be shown on the screen
Which changes should the student make to the time-base and the \(y\)-gain of the CRO so that the screen shows a continuous trace for one complete cycle of the waveform?
The graph shows the variation with time of the displacement of a particle in a progressive wave
Two measurements, \(x\) and \(y\), are labelled on the graph
What do \(x\) and \(y\) represent?
a frequency less than \(f\) that decreases as the car moves from P towards Q
a frequency less than \(f\) that increases as the car moves from P towards Q
a frequency more than \(f\) that decreases as the car moves from P towards Q
a frequency more than \(f\) that increases as the car moves from P towards Q
A car travels at a constant speed along a straight line PQ
A loudspeaker attached to the car emits sound of constant frequency \(f.\) A stationary observer is at point O
What does the observer hear as the car moves from P towards Q?
1 \(\rightarrow\) 3 \(\rightarrow\) 4 \(\rightarrow\) 2
2 \(\rightarrow\) 4 \(\rightarrow\) 1 \(\rightarrow\) 3
2 \(\rightarrow\) 4 \(\rightarrow\) 3 \(\rightarrow\) 1
3 \(\rightarrow\) 1 \(\rightarrow\) 4 \(\rightarrow\) 2
Some sources of electromagnetic waves in free space are listed
1 a radio wave transmitter
2 a source of X-rays
3 a 30 mm wavelength radar transmitter
4 a light-emitting diode that emits red light
Which list gives the sources in order of increasing wavelength, from left to right, of the waves emitted by the sources?
A vertically polarised beam of light is incident normally on a polarising filter. The transmission axis of the filter is at an angle of \(40^{\circ}\) to the horizontal
What is the ratio amplitude of transmitted beam ? amplitude of incident beam
The waves must be coherent
The waves must be of the same type
The waves must be travelling in opposite directions
The waves must meet in phase
Two progressive waves meet at a point
Which condition must be met for superposition of the waves to occur?
A string is stretched between a vibration generator and a fixed point

When the vibration generator is vibrating at a frequency \(f,\) a stationary wave with five nodes is created on the stretched string, as shown. There is a node at the end of the string that is attached to the vibration generator
The frequency of vibration of the vibration generator is slowly increased
What is the next frequency that produces a stationary wave on the string?
double the amplitude of the ripples
double the width of the gap
halve the frequency of the ripples
halve the wavelength of the ripples

A ripple tank and a barrier with a single gap are used to demonstrate the diffraction of surface ripples on water. Initially, the wavelength of the ripples is five times smaller than the gap in the barrier
Which change increases the amount of diffraction observed?
A laser produces a beam of light of wavelength \(650 \text{nm}\). The beam is incident normally on two slits that are a distance of \(0.12 \text{mm}\) apart
A screen is placed parallel to the slits. The bright interference fringes on the screen have a separation of \(7.5 \text{cm}\)
What is the distance between the screen and the two slits?
A beam of light from a laser is incident normally on a diffraction grating
The diagram shows only the **second**-order maxima that are produced
The grating has a line spacing of \(1.0 \times 10^{- 6} \text{m}\). The angle between the two second-order maxima is \(110^{\circ}\)
What is the wavelength of the light?
The electric current in a metal wire is \(4.0 \text{mA}\)
How many electrons pass a fixed point in the wire in a time of 10 hours?
the charge per unit time passing through the component
the energy transferred per unit charge
the force per unit charge
the resistance per unit current
What is the definition of the potential difference across an electrical component?
Which graph shows the \(I - V\) characteristic of a filament lamp?
A metal wire has a length of \(2.50 \text{m}\) and a cross-sectional area of \(4.50 \times 10^{-6} \text{m}^2\). The resistivity of the metal is \(3.50 \times 10^{-7} \Omega \text{m}\)
The wire is stretched so that its length increases to \(2.65 \text{m}\). The wire remains cylindrical and the **volume** of the wire remains constant
What is the change in the resistance of the wire?
Which circuit symbol represents a microphone?
A battery with internal resistance is connected to a fixed resistor, an ammeter and a voltmeter, as shown
The battery is replaced by a different battery that has the same electromotive force (e.m.f.) but a greater internal resistance
What happens to the readings on the ammeter and voltmeter?

table.html:
ammeter readingvoltmeter reading
Adecreasesdecreases
Bdecreasesstays the same
Cstays the samedecreases
Dstays the samestays the same

content.text: Four potential divider circuits each consist of a battery of electromotive force (e.m.f.) 9V and negligible internal resistance connected to a combination of resistors. Each of the resistors in the circuits has a resistance of \(X\) or \(2X\)
Which circuit has the largest output voltage \(V\) ?
A voltmeter is connected into a circuit with the polarity shown
The sliding contact is moved to end P of the potentiometer and then to end Q
What are the two readings of the voltmeter?

table.html:
sliding contact at end Psliding contact at end Q
A0V3V
B0V6V
C3V3V
D3V6V

content.text: A proton has mass \(m_{\mathrm{p}}\) and charge \(+e\)
What are the mass and charge of an antiproton?
E 87 X
X E X
E X E X E X E X E X E X E X E X E X E X E
A uranium nucleus has 92 protons and 143 neutrons
The nucleus emits a total of 3 \(\alpha\)-particles and 4 \(\beta^{-}\) particles to form nucleus X
How can nucleus X be represented?
A proton is a baryon but not a meson
A proton is a meson but not a hadron
A proton is both a hadron and a meson
A proton is both a meson and a baryon
Which statement about a proton is correct?
